basic_info.description: ðŸ‘‹ I'm Mike! I am a formally trained software engineer with years of professional experience building full stack web and non-web applications. These applications ranged from operational support software to detailed energy data analytics and included both structured SQL and unstructured data. While software engineering accounts for the bulk of my professional career, it is far from the only set of skills in my repertoire. Working primarily with startup companies has provided me with multifaceted skillsets, from frontend UI/UX development to bare metal electrical/mechanical engineering work. While earning my Master's degree at University of Massachusetts Lowell, I developed a passion for 3D printing and its adjacent technologies and wrote one of the first cloud-based slicing engines, consisting of software that turns digital models into 3D printer compatible gcode. At Zea Biosciences I built a platform which took both user and sensor data to do live plant condition analysis.

projects.title: Car Restoration
projects.description: One of my passtimes is spending time in my garage restoring my 1960 Buick LeSabre and my 1971 Chevrolet C10. Before I was a Software Engineer I worked as an auto shop mechanic where I fell in love with american classics

projects.title: Photography
projects.description: I enjoy photography as one of my extended hobbies and have been paid professionally for my work. Usually focusing on nature and portrait photography.

projects.title: Cats
projects.description: My wife and I have two demons that happen to take the form of cats. Their names are Frankie and Freya and I'm totally kidding about the demon part... mostly.
